intro: Boechera pallidifolia, commonly known as the paleleaf rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This perennial species typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or arid environments. Its small, white flowers bloom in early spring, and its leaves are characterized by their pale green color and lobed shape. Boechera pallidifolia is adapted to harsh conditions, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
